newsitem.title: SPAIN: BASKETBALL-ITALY AND GREECE WIN QUALIFYING GROUPS.
newsitem.headline: BASKETBALL-ITALY AND GREECE WIN QUALIFYING GROUPS.

text.p: Italy and Greece won their second-phase groups in the European basketball championships on Tuesday to earn straightforward quarter-final games against Turkey and Poland respectively.
France and Israel were the two sides eliminated from Group E, while 1993 champions Germany and the hotly-tipped Croatian side made early exits in Group F.
Greece survived some difficult moments to win their game against Israel 85-82 and with it Group E.
Greek coach Panagiotis Giannakis said he was pleased with the performance of his side so far in the tournament.
"I never thought we would achieve six consecutive victories," he said.
But Giannakis warned against overconfidence in the game against Poland, who took the last qualifying place in Group F with a 86-76 win over Germany.
"Poland is a country with a great basketball tradition," he said.
The other unbeaten side, Italy, will face Turkey who beat France 82-71.
Italy's five consecutive victories -- including wins over both Yugoslavia and Spain -- were enough for them to win Group F even before Tuesday's game with Croatia, which started late.
Yugoslavia took second place in the group after beating the hosts 79-70.
The result earnt the Yugoslavs a quarter-final slot against the losers of the game between Russia and Lithuania, which also started late.
Spain will face the winners of the same match in the last quarter final.
